watched.title: The world wasted nearly 1 billion metric tons of food in 2019
watched.copy: The world wasted about 931 million metric tons of food in 2019 — an average of 121 kilograms per person. That’s about 17 percent of all food that was available to consumers that year, a new United Nations report estimates.

watched.title: Climate Change Will Cost Us Even More Than We Think
watched.copy: Economists greatly underestimate the price tag on harsher weather and higher seas. Why is that?

watched.title: NASA: Global Warming
watched.copy: Throughout its long history, Earth has warmed and cooled time and again. Climate has changed when the planet received more or less sunlight due to subtle shifts in its orbit, as the atmosphere or surface changed, or when the Sun’s energy varied. But in the past century, another force has started to influence Earth’s climate: humanity.

watched.title: Global warming is a problem, but so are climate doomsayers
watched.copy: OPINION. Bjorn Lomborg, a visiting professor at the Copenhagen Business School. Most people on the planet wake up each day thinking that things are getting worse. It is little wonder, given what they routinely read in the newspaper or see on television. But this gloomy mood is a problem, because it feeds into scare stories about how climate change will end in Armageddon.

watched.title: DON'T PANIC — Hans Rosling showing the facts about population
watched.copy: 58 min lecture by hans rosling about the distribution of population and population growth

watched.title: Triggered - CNN's Climate Propaganda Night
watched.copy: Last night was CNN's climate propaganda night. The top 10 Democratic candidates headed into an echo chamber to discuss their radical climate change policies. Matt and Storm discuss.

watched.title: Vietnam: Climate change threatens rice production
watched.copy: 4 min (UN) report on the effects of climate change on rice production in Vietnam farmlands

watched.title: Vietnam: Climate change threatens rice production
watched.copy: 4 min (UN) report on the effects of climate change on rice production in Vietnam farmlands

watched.title: Living Planet: Unexpected ideas
watched.copy: On this week's show, Spain grapples with the environmental impact of the renewable energy boom. Young entrepreneurs in Kenya discover how a tiny critter can make a big impact on food waste. And Mexico takes the lead in kicking the herbicide glyphosate to the curb for the sake of its native bees.

watched.title: The New Face Of Climate Change — The Climate Migrant
watched.copy: 4 min (VICE) report on potential climate refugees/migrants in mexico

watched.title: How to Save Our Planet
watched.copy: 8 min (WWF) video essay arguing that biodiversity is essential to create a stable climate for humans

watched.title: Exposing Washington: Man-made climate change is a hoax
watched.copy: We will discuss how CNN is pushing the climate change hoax on the American people.

watched.title: Can Climate Models Predict Climate Change?
watched.copy: 5 min animation on why climate change models fail to work

watched.title: Presumed Effects of “Fake News” on the Global Warming Discussion in a Cross-Cultural Context
watched.copy: “Fake news” on global warming is widely disseminated via social and partisan media. Scientists worry about its effect, because fake news may hurt public support and change policy on climate change. The current study tested the roles of cultural constructs (individualism, collectivism, and uncertainty-avoidance) in predicting the presumed effect of fake news on global warming

watched.title: Climate 101: Deforestation | National Geographic
watched.copy: 3 min (NatGeo) animation on large scale deforestation across the globe, causes and effects

watched.title: Leonardo DiCaprio (UN Messenger of Peace) at the opening of Climate Summit 2014
watched.copy: 4 min (UN) speech by Leonardo DiCaprio arguing that the climate crisis is urgent and must be adressed

watched.title: The state of the climate crisis | Climate Action Tracker
watched.copy: 5 min (TED) animated video on predicted temperature rise and the actions countries take to reduce their emissions

watched.title: How could veganism change the world? | The Economist
watched.copy: 6 min (Economist) video essay on the effects of a plant based diet on the environment

watched.title: Climate Change: What Happens If The World Warms Up By 4°C?
watched.copy: 2 min (skynews) animation about the possible effects of a temperature rise of 4 degrees celsius
